1.text: Him being weak in faith receive ye, not to judgments of conversations.

2.text: One truly believes to eat all things: and he being weak eats vegetables.

3.text: Let not him eating despise him not eating: and let not him not eating judge him eating: for God has received him.

4.text: Who art thou judging anotherâ€™s servant? to his own lord he stands or falls. And he shall be made to stand: for God is powerful to make him stand.

5.text: For one truly judges day above day: and one judges every day. Let each one be perfectly certain in his own mind.

6.text: He minding the day, minds to the Lord; and he not minding the day, to the Lord he minds not. He eating, eats to the Lord, for he gives thanks to God; and he not eating, to the Lord he eats not, and he gives thanks to God.

7.text: For none of us lives to himself, and none dies to himself.

8.text: For whether we live, to the Lord we live: and whether we die, to the Lord we die: therefore whether we live, and whether we die, we are of the Lord.

9.text: For, for this Christ also died, and also arose, and returned again to life, that he might also reign over the dead and the living.

10.text: And why judgest thou thy brother? or why also despisest thou thy brother? for we shall all stand at the judgment seat of Christ.

11.text: For it has been written, I live, says the Lord, for to me shall every knee bend, and every tongue acknowledge to God.

12.text: So therefore shall each of us give word for himself to God.

13.text: Then let us no more judge one another: but rather judge ye this, not to put a stumble or offence to thy brother.

14.text: I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing common by itself; except to any one reckoning to be common, to that one it is common.

15.text: And if by food thy brother is grieved, thou no more walkest by love. Not by thy food destroy him, for whom Christ died.

16.text: Therefore let not your good be defamed.

17.text: For the kingdom of God is not food and drink; but justice, and peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.

18.text: For he in these serving Christ, pleasing to God, and acceptable to men.

19.text: So therefore, let us pursue the things of peace, and the things for the building up for one another.

20.text: Not for sake of food destroy thou the work of God. Truly all things clean; but evil to the man eating by offence.

21.text: Good not to eat flesh, nor drink wine, nor in what thy brother stumbles, or is offended, or is weak.

22.text: Thou has faith; have to thyself before God. Happy he judging not himself in what he proves.

23.text: And he being judged if he eat, has been condemned for not of faith; and everything not of faith is sin.
